ThingDef.label: purple nebula dragon
ThingDef.description: A purple nebula dragon. The key distinctive feature of nebula dragon is its strange energy "mane" usually found on its back that, when in flying through space, this mane engulfs dragons entire body and gives a look of a comet while also allowing them to travel at much higher speed.\n\n They arent as aggressive as usual dragons due to their space faring nature but when hungry, they will kill anything that comes into contact. Also unlike regular dragons, nebula dragon spit causes burns but without actually igniting the area on fire. Additionally every now and then it sheds strange dust.

li.label: Nebula breath
li.description: Fires a massive stream of super-heated gas and dust at the target. Causes severe burns but does not set the area on fire.

li.label: Stardust breath
li.description: Engulfs target in glimmering dust. Does no direct damage but causes EMP efffect.

The key distinctive feature of nebula dragon is its strange energy "mane" usually found on its back that, when in flying through space, this mane engulfs dragons entire body and gives a look of a comet while also allowing them to travel at much higher speed.\n\n They arent as aggressive as usual dragons due to their space faring nature but when hungry, they will kill anything that comes into contact. ThingDef.label: Black-Hole dragon
ThingDef.description:
A void class dragon known for their different appearance and aggressive behaviour compared to other void class dragons. These dragons typically lack any rune markings that most, if not all other void class dragon have. 

Instead, they have scar-like cuts on their chest, back or wings. What purpose these openings serve is unknown, but from old archotech databanks there are records speculating that openings act as "vents" to passively flush out excess energy from their bodies. But it has no data whatsoever regarding the cause of this energy build up. Despite that, there is data regarding its behaviour. 

Specifically the abnormal aggression towards any other dragon due to unknown reasons. Some data suggests that it's due to isiolationist nature of these dragons. To anyone that encounters them, extreme caution is advised.

li.label: Void Breath
li.description: Fires a volley of small singularities causing explosions upon imapct.

li.label: Molten Spit
li.description: Spits several molten projectiles. Completely negates armor.

li.label: Eclipse
li.description: Fires a micro blackhole at target location causing a small anti-grain like explosion.

ThingDef.label: Destroyer dragon
ThingDef.description:
Destroyer - A void class dragon that gets its name from abnormal behaviour. Compared to other void dragons, Destroyers have a total lack of care when it comes to collateral damage. Normally a dragon would limit its attacks to prevent annihilating its prey in order to feed. Destroyers don't have such limit, or any limit at all when it comes to fighting or hunting, which often results in prey getting obliterated. 

This reckless state also prevents them from using more "advanced" abilities that require focus. But it also has its benefits - as compared to other dragons they are capable of various mass bombardments without much effort, something that other dragons would really struggle to achieve. On top of that, they are also far better fighters in close range. 

It is also worth noting their runes. As destruction often causes markings to glow and pulse as if the very release of energy somehow sates it, appease it. Their behaviour also changes based on how saturated its markings are. Saturated markings indicated that dragon is content. Desaturated markings on the other hand... Well, pray that it doesn't see you.

li.label: Void Breath
li.description: Fires a volley of small singularities causing explosions upon imapct.

li.label: Molten Spit
li.description: Spits several molten projectiles. Completely negates armor.

li.label: Hellfire
li.description: Fires several condensed gas/liquid projectiles. Anything caught in the explosion suffers heavy damage and massive amounts of pain.

li.label: Rend
li.description: Fires pair of condensed energy bolts causing medium but very high damage explosions. Can be negated with heavy armor. Very inaccurate at long range.

ThingDef.label: World eater dragon
ThingDef.description:
Eater - A void class dragon whose name is self explanatory. Having abnormal if not insane hunger compared to others, aptly named World Eaters are essentially a living extinction event for any creature it considers as food. 

Despite being somewhat similiar to destroyers appearance wise, these void dragons lack strenght both in terms of abilities as well as close combat. Their powerful jaws being the only exception. Under normal circumstances these dragons should be extinct as due to weaker state they can be considered as prey. However, this is not the case. Because what they lack in general state, they make up with unique condition - The Abyssal Hunger. 

Periodically an odd change in behaviour occurs to them which might explain as to why they arent hunted by other void dwellers. As their reflexes sharpen, reactions become faster, fatigue and exhaustion become nonexistant. They even learn new abilities, although they seem to only them when in this state. Based on some glitterworld research papers and observations, around every start of new season(quadrum) World Eaters start showing signs of Abyssal Hunger. Which progresses and ends after around 5 days. 

First, the initial "agitation" and quick responsiveness. After 36 hours this effect increases dramatically and also makes them far more dangerous. After 48 hours most of its sharp reflexes fade away in an instant, no need for rest being only exception. It is also the reason they get the name World Eaters. As during this time dragons metabolism skyrockets and forces it to do nothing but eat. Exact reason this happens is unknown. But there are strange occurences and sightings reported of World Eaters the size of small moons. It's possible that what looks like adult World Eater for a person is in fact nothing more than a juvenile capable of standing on its own. If encountered, it is advised to isolate/lockdown with as much food supplies as possible and wait until it moves on.

li.label: Void Breath
li.description: Fires a volley of small singularities causing explosions upon imapct.

li.label: Rend
li.description: Fires pair of condensed energy bolts causing medium but very high damage explosions. Can be negated with heavy armor. Very inaccurate at long range.

li.label: Constrain
li.description: Fires a single volatile energy bolt that causes minor damage but incapacitates target for about 2 hours.

ThingDef.label: Harbinger dragon
ThingDef.description: Harbinger - A void class dragon that is shrouded in mystery as there is very little information about them. Their appearance is that of regular black dragon with few exceptions: rune markings all over the body, abnormal horn formation and lack of regular eyes. There is also a possibility of having other unknown features. \n\nIn terms of behaviour they are also very similiar to a generic dragon as Harbingers aren't as inherently destructive and violent. Often using abilities that break targets mind instead of using brute force. Harbingers also tend to collect their hoard like regular dragons(which is odd as void dragons tend to be nomadic), but instead of gold or silver they seek trinkets, artifacts and objects that are potent with energy. It's also the reason they're named Harbingers. As there are many stories from tribals about these dragons presence often causing heat waves, famine and other disasters shortly after it leaves.

li.label: Void Breath
li.description: Fires a volley of small singularities causing explosions upon imapct.

li.label: Void Surge
li.description: Envelops target in void energy granting powerful boost to attributes. Causes minor bruises.

li.label: Mind Flay
li.description: Rends apart users mind and forces it go berserk out of sheer panic. Does minimal direct damage.

li.label: Constrain
li.description: Fires a single volatile energy bolt that causes minor damage but incapacitates target for about 2 hours.

ThingDef.label: Rurelion dragon
ThingDef.description: A rather peculiar space dragon. Rurelion Zol is highly intelligent, creative and very arrogant dragon capable of speech. Apparently it is the reason why stars exist as it among its kin are the creators of the universe. \n\nStrangely enough despite all that it is rather docile for a dragon due to a simple desire to have a conversation about how great it is. Also note: do not mention words Bargon or Rantheon if you value your life. Do not ask for why.

li.label: Stardust breath
li.description: Engulfs target in glimmering dust. Does no direct damage but causes EMP efffect.

li.label: Rurelion breath
li.description: Fires condensed light at foes causing massive explosion.
